001package io.github.ai4ci.config.inhost;
002
003import org.immutables.value.Value;
004
005import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonDeserialize;
006import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonSerialize;
007
008import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak;
009import io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.DemographicAdjustment;
010import io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.ExecutionConfiguration;
011import io.github.ai4ci.functions.Distribution;
012import io.github.ai4ci.functions.SimpleDistribution;
013
014/**
015 * Configuration for an in‑host Markov state model.
016 *
017 * <p>
018 * This interface describes the distributions and parameters used by the
019 * simplistic in‑host Markov model implementation. It supplies distributions for
020 * incubation, infectious and symptom durations, and for the immune waning
021 * half‑life. Implementations are primarily consumed by the initialiser and
022 * state classes that set up and manage an individual's in‑host state.
023 *
024 * <p>
025 * Downstream uses include the initialisers and builders such as
026 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultInHostMarkovStateInitialiser},
027 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultPersonInitialiser} and
028 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultInHostPhenomenologicalStateInitialiser}.
029 * It is also referenced by example and test code such as
030 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.example.Experiment}.
031 *
032 * @author Rob Challen
033 */
034@Value.Immutable
035@JsonSerialize(as = ImmutableMarkovStateModel.class)
036@JsonDeserialize(as = ImmutableMarkovStateModel.class)
037public interface MarkovStateModel extends InHostConfiguration,
038                DemographicAdjustment.Markov<Distribution, Double> {
039
040        /**
041         * A sensible default parameterisation of the Markov model.
042         *
043         * <p>
044         * This instance provides a small set of log‑normal distributions used as a
045         * baseline in examples and tests. Downstream callers that rely on a simple
046         * default include {@link io.github.ai4ci.example.Experiment}.
047         *
048         * @see io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultInHostMarkovStateInitialiser
049         */
050        public static ImmutableMarkovStateModel DEFAULT = ImmutableMarkovStateModel
051                        .builder()
052                        .setImmuneWaningHalfLife(SimpleDistribution.logNorm(300D, 10D))
053                        .setIncubationPeriod(SimpleDistribution.logNorm(5D, 2D))
054                        .setInfectiousDuration(SimpleDistribution.logNorm(8D, 3D))
055                        .setSymptomDuration(SimpleDistribution.logNorm(5D, 3D)).build();
056
057        /**
058         * Distribution for the half life of waning immunity.
059         *
060         * <p>
061         * This distribution describes the expected time scale for immune waning and
062         * is sampled when determining the decay of immunity after recovery or
063         * vaccination. It is consulted by initialisers and state updaters. The
064         * distribution is not age specific in this model but may be modified by
065         * {@link DemographicAdjustment.Markov} implementations that provide
066         * age‑specific adjustments to the symptom duration distribution in the form
067         * of an odds ratio.
068         *
069         * @return a {@link io.github.ai4ci.functions.Distribution} representing the
070         *         immune waning half life
071         */
072        @Override
073        Distribution getImmuneWaningHalfLife();
074
075        /**
076         * Distribution for the incubation period (time from infection to onset).
077         *
078         * <p>
079         * This distribution is sampled by initialisers such as
080         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultInHostMarkovStateInitialiser}
081         * and by phenomenological initialisers when converting to internal state
082         * durations. It is not age specific in this model but may be modified by
083         * {@link DemographicAdjustment.Markov} implementations that provide
084         * age‑specific adjustments to the incubation period distribution in the form
085         * of a odds ratio.
086         *
087         * @return a {@link io.github.ai4ci.functions.Distribution} used to sample
088         *         incubation periods
089         */
090        @Override
091        Distribution getIncubationPeriod();
092
093        /**
094         * Distribution for the infectious duration.
095         *
096         * <p>
097         * This value is not age specific in the current model. Callers include the
098         * default initialiser which samples an infectious duration for each infected
099         * individual. The distribution is not age specific in this model but may be
100         * modified by {@link DemographicAdjustment.Markov} implementations that
101         * provide age‑specific adjustments to the symptom duration distribution in
102         * the form of an odds ratio.
103         *
104         * @return a {@link io.github.ai4ci.functions.Distribution} for infectious
105         *         duration
106         */
107        @Override
108        Distribution getInfectiousDuration(); // not age specfic
109
110        /**
111         * Severity cutoff used to decide whether an infected individual is classed
112         * as fatal.
113         *
114         * <p>
115         * The default implementation derives the cutoff from the
116         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.ExecutionConfiguration#getInfectionFatalityRate()}
117         * as 1 minus the fatality rate. This is used when mapping severity to death
118         * outcomes in the outbreak and state logic.
119         *
120         * @param outbreak      the current outbreak context
121         * @param configuration the execution configuration providing fatality rates
122         * @return the cutoff in the unit interval [0,1] used to classify fatality
123         */
124        @Override
125        default double getSeverityFatalityCutoff(
126                        Outbreak outbreak, ExecutionConfiguration configuration
127        ) {
128                return 1 - configuration.getInfectionFatalityRate();
129        }
130        // NB not modifiable at present
131
132        // The markov model has no internal representation of continuous severity
133        // and the cutoffs are arbitrary
134
135        /**
136         * Severity cutoff used to decide whether an infected individual is classed
137         * as hospitalised.
138         *
139         * <p>
140         * The default implementation derives the cutoff from the
141         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.ExecutionConfiguration#getInfectionHospitalisationRate()}
142         * as 1 minus the hospitalisation rate. Downstream uses include the same
143         * baseline and state classes that interpret severity measures.
144         *
145         * @param outbreak      the current outbreak context
146         * @param configuration the execution configuration providing hospitalisation
147         *                      rates
148         * @return the cutoff in the unit interval [0,1] used to classify
149         *         hospitalisation
150         */
151        @Override
152        default double getSeverityHospitalisationCutoff(
153                        Outbreak outbreak, ExecutionConfiguration configuration
154        ) {
155                return 1 - configuration.getInfectionHospitalisationRate();
156        }
157        // NB not modifiable at present
158
159        /**
160         * Severity cutoff used to decide whether an infected individual is classed
161         * as a symptomatic case.
162         *
163         * <p>
164         * The default implementation derives the cutoff from the
165         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.ExecutionConfiguration#getInfectionCaseRate()}
166         * as 1 minus the case rate. This method is used by classes such as
167         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.abm.OutbreakBaseline},
168         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.abm.PersonState} and
169         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultOutbreakBaseliner} to map a
170         * continuous severity measure to discrete outcomes.
171         *
172         * @param outbreak      the current outbreak context
173         * @param configuration the execution configuration providing attack rates
174         * @return the cutoff in the unit interval [0,1] used to classify symptoms
175         */
176        @Override
177        default double getSeveritySymptomsCutoff(
178                        Outbreak outbreak, ExecutionConfiguration configuration
179        ) {
180                return 1 - configuration.getInfectionCaseRate();
181        }
182        // NB not modifiable at present
183
184        /**
185         * Distribution for the duration of symptoms.
186         *
187         * <p>
188         * Used by initialisers to determine how long symptomatic states last. The
189         * distribution is not age specific in this model but may be modified by
190         * {@link DemographicAdjustment.Markov} implementations that provide
191         * age‑specific adjustments to the symptom duration distribution in the form
192         * of an odds ratio.
193         *
194         * @return a {@link io.github.ai4ci.functions.Distribution} for symptom
195         *         duration
196         */
197        @Override
198        Distribution getSymptomDuration(); // not age specfic
199
200}
